ygData.subject: RE: Proc'ing; Dex vrs Wis (was Bard PvP)
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, I see my PGT proc even if I am swatting at bixies.  Is 164 dex good?  buffed of course. Sylly ... From:	Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, I see my PGT proc even if I am swatting at bixies. Is 164 dex good?
<eg> buffed of course.

Sylly

-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
[mailto:Michael.Garramone@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 29, 1999 5:19 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Proc'ing; Dex vrs Wis (was
Bard PvP)

From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)"
<Michael.Garramone@...>

everyone believes it to be dex. i have yet to hear that
wisdom plays a
role. i think the consensus on dex is that if you hit more
often, you will
proc more often. sounds like it makes sense, but the
problem is you do NOT
have to hit to proc, you just have to swing. i have taken
notice of this
after asking a level 50 warrior friend of mine for advice on
stats for my
paladin, and he mentioned that. with my paladin, for a fact
i have seen
myself miss the first 3 swings of a fight, i inflicted no
melee damage, yet
my ghoulbane definitely did proc. dunno if this is common
knowledge to
everyone, it surprised me.
